title: SuiteGenie Update: Cross-Posting, Scheduling Reliability, and Analytics Visibility Across X, LinkedIn, and Threads
excerpt: A major reliability-focused update across Tweet Genie, LinkedIn Genie, and Social Genie: better cross-posting parity, timezone-safe schedules, stronger session persistence, and clearer analytics tracking.
content:
## Quick Answer

We shipped a reliability-heavy cross-platform update that makes SuiteGenie more consistent across X, LinkedIn, and Threads, especially for scheduling, mirrored cross-post visibility, and analytics tracking.

## What Improved (High Impact)

### 1. Cross-Posting Schedule Visibility Across Apps
- Scheduled cross-posts now appear more consistently in target apps as read-only mirrored rows
- Ownership remains clear with labels like `Managed in Tweet Genie` or `Managed in LinkedIn Genie`
- Teams can verify planned posts without duplicating schedule management

### 2. Timezone Consistency for Mirrored Scheduled Posts
- Fixed schedule time mismatches caused by timezone parsing differences between apps
- Mirrored rows now display the correct scheduled time with timezone labels (for example `Asia/Kolkata`)
- This reduces one of the most confusing issues in cross-platform scheduling workflows

### 3. Better Cross-Posting Coverage in Social Genie (Threads)
- Threads scheduling and cross-post visibility received multiple fixes so users can track what is scheduled and what is managed externally
- Meta/Threads compose flow now exposes cross-post controls in the right places for real publishing workflows

### 4. Analytics Now Reflects More Scheduled and Cross-Posted Content
- Analytics tracking improved for scheduled and externally created posts
- Recent-post sections help users confirm that content they scheduled or cross-posted is actually being tracked
- This is especially useful for validating team workflows and cross-platform publishing

### 5. Session and Authentication Reliability Improvements
- Session expiry and token refresh handling was tightened so users are less likely to get logged out unexpectedly during active use
- This matters for bulk scheduling and scheduled publishing reliability across longer windows

## Team Workflow Progress (Practical, Not Heavy)

We also started improving team cross-posting with a more controlled approach:
- explicit target account selection (instead of ambiguous defaults)
- safer account routing behavior for team publishing
- stronger attribution for analytics and history

This makes it easier to support real scenarios like posting from one team member's X account to another team member's LinkedIn account without introducing confusing automation rules.

## Quality of Life Fixes Included
- cleaner scheduler status text rendering in UI
- improved dev environment behavior for connection checks (Vite proxy/base URL consistency)
- more predictable scheduling lead-time behavior in Tweet Genie
- credits and monthly reset behavior aligned more clearly with plan logic

## Why This Release Matters

Most social media tools talk about multi-platform posting. The hard part is making it reliable when teams, scheduling, analytics, and account ownership all interact.

This update focused on that execution layer: fewer hidden mismatches, clearer visibility, and better confidence when you are shipping content at scale.

## What This Means for Agencies, Teams, and Creators
- More trustworthy cross-platform scheduling views
- Better analytics confidence after scheduled or cross-posted publishing
- Fewer interruptions caused by session/auth edge cases
- Cleaner multi-account workflows as team routing support expands

## What's Next

We are continuing to improve team cross-post routing (account-to-account targeting) and expanding reporting/retention features for long-term content operations.

If you are running a multi-platform calendar, this release should feel meaningfully more stable in day-to-day use.
